data.title: Pitbull Stadium? ¡Dale! Singer has naming rights to Florida International football stadium
data.meta_description: The FIU football stadium will be known as Pitbull Stadium for at least the next five years after the agreement announced Tuesday, August 6, 2024.
data.text:
Paws up! ¡Dale!

Pitbull, the Miami-based rapper known as "Mr. Worldwide" and "Mr. 305," signed a first-of-its-kind deal with Florida International for the naming rights of its football stadium Tuesday morning, August 6. The Panthers' field will be called Pitbull Stadium for at least the next five years. It's the first sports venue in the world named after a musical artist, according to the school.

As part of the $6 million deal, Pitbull's branded vodka also will be sold at the stadium, and as the "Official Entrepreneur of FIU Athletics," he will write a new FIU anthem.

“What we’re doing here is groundbreaking. We’re making history. This is history in the making,” Pitbull said at a ceremony on the campus Tuesday. “You’re going to see every other university wants to do the same thing. But the difference is we don’t do this for propaganda. We do it from the heart. We do it because it’s meaningful. We do it because I’m from the crib. I’m 305. This is my backyard.”

Here's what to know about Pitbull and the FIU stadium deal:

Details of Pitbull-FIU stadium deal

Here's what the agreement contains, according to ESPN:

Pitbull pays $1.2 million per year.

Pitbull gets naming rights to FIU football stadium through 2028 (with an option for Pitbull to renew the deal through 2033).

Pitbull's Voli 305 Vodka will be the preferred brand sold at the stadium.

Pitbull will get use of the stadium 10 days per year.

Pitbull gets two reserved suites for each home game.

Pitbull gets the title "Official Entrepreneur of FIU Athletics."

Pitbull will write an anthem for FIU.

What is Pitbull's name? Is he from Florida?

The music star known as Pitbull was born Armando Christian Pérez on January 15, 1981, in Miami. His parents immigrated to Florida from Cuba before he was born.

He has celebrated his South Florida heritage throughout his career, foremost with his "Mr. 305" moniker highlighting Miami's area code.

Did Pitbull go to FIU?

Despite signing a naming rights deal at the football stadium, Pitbull did not graduate from Florida International. In fact, he didn't go to college at all, or even graduate from high school, the singer said at Tuesday's news conference. He did say he has ties to the school through “people that I love dearly.” He also emphasized that investing in education has become one of his passions.

How did Pitbull get famous?

Pitbull's first record deal came in 2001 when he signed with the company of Luther Campbell, founder of 2 Live Crew and one of the Miami Hurricanes' most famous boosters. His debut album "M.I.A.M.I." was released in 2004, and he soared to popularity in the 2010s with party anthems "Give Me Everything," "I Know You Want Me (Calle Ocho)," "Don't Stop the Party" and "Timber."

Pitbull has landed hits on both English- and Spanish-language charts, with his album "Dale" winning a Grammy in 2016 for Best Latin Rock, Urban or Alternative Album.

What is Pitbull's net worth?

Pitbull is worth about $100 million. His concert tours and musical achievements are a big part of that, but Pitbull also has several endorsement deals and co-founded Bad Boy Latino records with Sean "Diddy" Combs. He also was paid $1 million by Visit Florida in 2015 to promote the state.

What are Pitbull's connections to sports?

Pitbull's music is ubiquitous across sports arenas and commercials. His song "Timber" featuring Kesha was used by ESPN throughout the 2014 NBA Playoffs, LeBron James' last season with the Miami Heat. He was also part of a group of singers featured in a Super Bowl commercial in 2020.

Pitbull also is co-owner of NASCAR team Trackhouse Racing and is scheduled to perform before the 2025 Daytona 500 (his 2024 pre-race concert was canceled because of rain).

FIU stadium details, capacity, location

Pitbull Stadium, formerly known as FIU Stadium, has a capacity of about 20,000. It opened in 1995.

The stadium is located to the north of Tamiami Park south of the FIU campus in Miami. It's about 9 miles northwest of the University of Miami campus in Coral Gables, and about 26 miles southwest of Hard Rock Stadium in Miami Gardens, where the Miami Hurricanes and Miami Dolphins play their home football games.

Does FIU have Division I football? Is it FBS or FCS?

FIU's first football season was in 2002, and it joined the Division I Football Bowl Subdivision in 2004. It plays in Conference USA.

FIU football schedule 2024: When is the first game at Pitbull Stadium?

FIU football's home opener at Pitbull Stadium is September 7 against Central Michigan.
